definition: fan/sliding, hinged or detachable flat part of sth/classifier for doors, windows etc
to fan/to slap sb on the face

sentences.english: It also marks bad sectors and recovers readable information.
sentences.chinese: 此命令也標記損壞的扇區和恢復可讀信息。

sentences.english: The 1-dimensional array of logical blocks is mapped into the sectors of the disk sequentially.
sentences.chinese: 邏輯塊的一維數組映射到磁盤上一些相連的扇區。

sentences.english: As you use your hard drive, it can develop bad sectors.
sentences.chinese: 當您使用您的硬盤驅動器，它可能形成壞扇區。

sentences.english: You can directly specify the color for each slice of your pie chart.
sentences.chinese: 您可以爲您扇形圖的每一個扇區直接指定顏色。

sentences.english: This option takes a number of sectors as an option.
sentences.chinese: 該選項將大量扇區作爲一個選項。

sentences.english: B. Indicates a danger area. C. Is used to identify the characteristics of the light.
sentences.chinese: 在海圖上，燈塔的燈光特點被顯示爲白和紅的扇區。

sentences.english: A technique for copy protection in which bad sectors are intentionally written on a disk.
sentences.chinese: 將若干壞扇區故意寫在盤上的一種拷貝保護技術。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, changing the apparent sector size in firmware can degrade performance.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾的是，在固件中改變表面扇區大小會降低性能。

sentences.english: It then loads kernels or the boot sectors of other operating systems.
sentences.chinese: 然後它加載內核或者其它操作系統的引導扇區。

sentences.english: Each sector has an independent sector simulation front-end module that is set inside the frame.
sentences.chinese: 每個扇區具有獨立的置於機框內部扇區模擬前端模塊。

sentences.chinese: 每個扇區具有獨立的置於機框內部扇區模擬前端模塊。
